snippet: The immersion of today’s leaders of China in the political experimentation that preceded the Tiananmen Square crackdown in 1989 raises the question of whether they will be open to new ideas and discussion.
abstract: China in 2013 will mark 24th anniversary of Tiananmen Square protests and bloody crackdown; immersion of current leaders of China in political experimentation that preceded 1989 crackdown raises question of whether they will be open to new ideas and discussion.

byline.original: By ANDREW JACOBS and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Andrew Jacobs reported from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The immersion of today’s leaders of China in the political experimentation that preceded the Tiananmen Square crackdown in 1989 raises the question of whether they will be open to new ideas and discussion.

headline.seo: China’s New Leadership Has Ties to Tiananmen Era
headline.main: Elite in China Molded in Part by Tiananmen
headline.print_headline: Elite in China Molded in Part By Tiananmen

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Politburo Standing Committee of the Communist Party of China
